detaileddescription.para:
Mix two colors with a given ratio.
c1
the first color to mix (usually the foreground)
c2
the second color to mix (usually the background)
mix
The ratio of the colors. 0: full c2, 255: full c1, 127: half c1 and halfc2
the mixed color

Mix two colors with a given ratio. It runs faster then lv_color_mix but requires some pre computation.
c1
The first color. Should be preprocessed with lv_color_premult(c1)
c2
The second color. As it is no pre computation required on it
mix
The ratio of the colors. 0: full c2, 255: full c1, 127: half c1 and half c2. Should be modified like mix = 255 - mix
the mixed color
255 won't give clearly c1.

memberdef.argsstring: (lv_color_t bg_color, lv_opa_t bg_opa, lv_color_t fg_color, lv_opa_t fg_opa, lv_color_t *res_color, lv_opa_t *res_opa)
memberdef.name: lv_color_mix_with_alpha

detaileddescription.para:
Mix two colors. Both color can have alpha value. It requires ARGB888 colors.
bg_color
background color
bg_opa
alpha of the background color
fg_color
foreground color
fg_opa
alpha of the foreground color
res_color
the result color
res_opa
the result opacity

Get the brightness of a color
color
a color
the brightness [0..255]

Convert a HSV color to RGB
h
hue [0..359]
s
saturation [0..100]
v
value [0..100]
the given RGB color in RGB (with LV_COLOR_DEPTH depth)

Convert a 32-bit RGB color to HSV
r8
8-bit red
g8
8-bit green
b8
8-bit blue
the given RGB color in HSV

Convert a color to HSV
color
color
the given color in HSV
